docs.lead_paragraph: One day after clearing a key Senate hurdle, legislation to renew long-term jobless benefits stood at a crossroads on Wednesday with gridlock beckoning from one direction and the prospect of compromise from the other.

headline.main: GOP Seeks Jobless Bill Changes to Offset the Cost
headline.print_headline: GOP Seeks Jobless Bill Changes to Offset the Cost

docs.lead_paragraph: In a decision that could make it easier for a broader category of people to adopt in New York state, a Manhattan judge has allowed the adoption of a child by two "close personal friends."

headline.main: N.Y. Court Allows 'Close Friends' to Adopt Child
headline.print_headline: N.Y. Court Allows 'Close Friends' to Adopt Child

docs.snippet: In a decision that could make it easier for a broader category of people to adopt in New York state, a Manhattan judge has allowed the adoption of a child by two "close personal friends."

docs.lead_paragraph: Utah will not recognize, at least for now, the marriages of gay couples who rushed to wed after a federal judge's ruling briefly legalized gay unions in the conservative, predominantly Mormon state, the governor's office said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Utah Puts Same-Sex Marriages on Hold Pending Appeal
headline.print_headline: Utah Puts Same-Sex Marriages on Hold Pending Appeal

docs.snippet: Utah will not recognize, at least for now, the marriages of gay couples who rushed to wed after a federal judge's ruling briefly legalized gay unions in the conservative, predominantly Mormon state, the governor's office said on Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some top U.S. health insurers are giving consumers more time to pay their Obamacare premiums, extending the deadline to the end of January for benefits that begin retroactively from January 1.

headline.main: Insurers Push Obamacare Payment Deadline to Late January
headline.print_headline: Insurers Push Obamacare Payment Deadline to Late January

docs.snippet: Some top U.S. health insurers are giving consumers more time to pay their Obamacare premiums, extending the deadline to the end of January for benefits that begin retroactively from January 1.

docs.lead_paragraph: Michael Mathie proposed to his partner Tyler McCraley on Christmas and obtained a marriage license the next day. They made plans for a wedding but couldn't carry through with it because the Supreme Court put same-sex marriage on hold before they could tie the knot.

headline.main: Confusion Resonates for Same-Sex Utah Couples
headline.print_headline: Confusion Resonates for Same-Sex Utah Couples

docs.abstract: The recovery of the average workweek since the recession has been held back by federal measures that make part-time work advantageous for employers or employees, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: The recovery of the average workweek since the recession has been held back by federal measures that make part-time work advantageous for employers or employees, an economist writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: The report is the second in two months to warn about flaws in the oversight of the ambitious federal program aimed at converting patient records from paper to electronic.

headline.main: Report Finds More Flaws in Digitizing Patient Files
headline.print_headline: Report Finds More Flaws in Digitizing Patient Files

docs.abstract: Federal oversight agency report says although government is spending more than $22 billion to encourage hospitals and doctors to adopt electronic health records, it has failed to put safeguards in place to prevent technology from being used for inflating costs and overbilling; report is second in two months to warn about oversight flaws.
docs.snippet: The report is the second in two months to warn about flaws in the oversight of the ambitious federal program aimed at converting patient records from paper to electronic.

byline.original: By REED ABELSON and JULIE CRESWELL

docs.lead_paragraph: Those who married during the two week-period when same-sex weddings were performed are left wondering whether their unions will be recognized by the state.

headline.main: Uncertainty in Utah as Appeals Process Plays Out Over Gay Marriage
headline.print_headline: Uncertainty in Utah as Appeals Process Plays Out Over Gay Marriage

docs.abstract: Legal struggle over Utah’s voter-approved ban on same-sex marriage has catapulted socially conservative state to center of national debate over who should be allowed to wed, and whether states have right to limit marriages to one man and one woman; couples married during two-week period when same-sex weddings were performed are left wondering whether their unions will be recognized by state.
docs.snippet: Those who married during the two week-period when same-sex weddings were performed are left wondering whether their unions will be recognized by the state.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Some see a political issue in a move to provide $6.4 billion in assistance to the unemployed, and Democrats were not optimistic that a deal could be reached.

headline.main: Vote in Senate Starts Talks on Extending Unemployment Benefits
headline.print_headline: Vote in Senate Starts Talks on Extending Unemployment Benefits

docs.abstract: Senate's unexpected vote to advance legislation extending expired unemployment benefits touches off delicate negotiations to secure final passage, even as Republicans and Democrats warily eye political motives behind efforts; some see political issue in move to provide $6.4 billion in assistance to unemployed, and Democrats are not optimistic that deal can be reached.
docs.snippet: Some see a political issue in a move to provide $6.4 billion in assistance to the unemployed, and Democrats were not optimistic that a deal could be reached.
